channel.title: For all Geniuses and Project Czar source users
channel.description: Where in the cleint. java file can I move all my Npc's. Sorry this may sound a little bit nooby, but is there anyway to locate a npc to move without looking through the whole file.. Could I just spawn it, and the Npc will stay? Help anyone?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 01, 2008, 02:19:19 PM[/size][hr]and uhhh.. how to make myself the owner? sorry for my noobness.. but please help me out

item.title: For all Geniuses and Project Czar source users
item.dc:creator: @G-Scape.no-ip.org G-Scape.no-ip.org
item.description:
@G-Scape.no-ip.org wrote:

Alright… so I opened up my Autospawn.cfg file and I changed his coords to edgeville, logged out, compiled, but nothing happened when I logged back on. Any suggestions on what to do?

Read full topic
item.source: For all Geniuses and Project Czar source users

item.title: For all Geniuses and Project Czar source users
item.dc:creator: @eviltwin1 eviltwin1
item.description:
@eviltwin1 wrote:

well with .cfg files i just right click them and open them with notepad
but anyways to change ur starting point go to player.java
search for // initial x and y coordinates of the player
then under that just change the x and y coords to the starting point. also if u have a ::home command open up client.java and search for "home" and change those coords awsell

Read full topic
item.source: For all Geniuses and Project Czar source users

item.title: For all Geniuses and Project Czar source users
item.dc:creator: @tuptup13 tuptup13
item.description:
@tuptup13 wrote:

teleportToX = 2899; teleportToY = 3557; //pEmote = 15; //pWalk = 13; sendMessage("Oh dear you died!"); hitDiff = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

Thats the tele co-ordinates for when you die. If you want to change a starting place hold on.

Read full topic
